title.value: Нанобиотехнологии и генетически модифицированные организмы: перспективы и проблемы использования в перерабатывающей промышленности
Nano-biotechnologies and genetically modified organisms: perspectives and problems of utilization in processing industry
Nano-biotechnologies and genetically modified organisms: perspectives and problems of utilization in processing industry

journal.title: Agropanorama : scientific and technical journal for the agro-industrial complex workers

person.name: Kazarovets, N.V., National Academy of Sciences of Belarus, Minsk (Belarus)
Rasolko, L.A., Belarus State Agrarian Technical Univ., Minsk (Belarus)

abstract.value: Nano-biotechnology represents the usage of cell culture of microorganisms (bacteria, yeast and fungi), plants and animals for metabolism of organic substances at cellular level. Genetically modified organisms (GMOs) are genetically engineering substances containing in the genetic apparatus fragments of DNA from any other live organisms. For the reception of GMOs genetic engineering is used on the basis of nano-biotechnologies. Transgenic organisms are called the ones have been subjected to the genetic transformation and in which the genes, introduced from other kinds of plants or animals, successfully function. Genetic engineering is purposed to the reception of new, easy-to-human characteristics. Modern GMOs market includes four segments: GM-foodstuffs, GM-feeds, GM-medicines and GM-microorganisms. All these products carry ambiguous connotations in global community due to insufficient knowledge of the influence of GMOs on human and animal health. The article presents a comprehensive review of use of GMOs in different spheres, analyzes opposite points of view on GMOs development, describes the situation of GMOs' utilization in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus and outlines the perspectives of the development of GMOs producing.
